speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's it for today.  Goodbye, and good listening.

speaker: Frasier
text: Little off our game today, aren't we, Roz?  Is something wrong?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes.  I told a guy I love him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Somebody you know this time?

speaker: Roz
text: [_gives him a look, then_] Forget it, Frasier, I know you don't like to hear about my love-life.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, don't be ridiculous.  I care about you.  If you have a problem, and I can help, I'd love to.  Just keep the details on a need-to-know basis.

speaker: Roz
text: OK.  We've been dating a couple of weeks, and last night he started licking me behind my ear.  See, I have this sweet little spot there...

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, Roz, is this--?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, you do need to know this.  So anyway, what I meant to say was, "Oh, I love that!"  But I got so caught up that I yelled out, "Oh, I love _you_!" and then all of a sudden he got this look on his face like Indiana Jones running from the big ball!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, uh, Roz, do you love him?

speaker: Roz
text: No!  But I said it, so he should have said it back, it's just polite.

speaker: Frasier
text: There is no more emotionally charged phrase in the language than "I love you."  Some people are just incapable of saying it, it makes them too vulnerable.  My father, for instance, incapable of saying "I love you," even to me.  But I know he does.

speaker: Roz
text: So your father never told you he loves you?  God, that explains so much.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is that supposed to mean?!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, maybe if he had, you wouldn't be so emotionally needy that when a close friend asks your advice, you have to steer the conversation back to your own problems.  So anyway, now that I told this guy I love him, how do I take it back?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_putting on his jacket_] Very simple, Roz.  Do you remember when I said that I cared about you and I'd like to help?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_picks up his briefcase_] I take it back.  _He strides out of the booth, leaving Roz gaping.  FADE OUT_  **I ONLY HAVE ICE FOR YOU**  _Scene Two -- Apartment Martin is going through his tackle box at the dinner table. Eddie jumps up and starts sniffing._

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie, get out of there!  You'll get a fishhook up your nose!

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't you ever clean that thing out?

speaker: Martin
text: No!  It's bad luck.  Everybody knows that.  You show up on a fishing trip with a tackle box that doesn't smell like the most rancid, rotten thing on the face of the earth, and nobody'll sit next to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Niles, I used to have the same problem with my multiple personality patients.  They always kept saying that the other one had sent the check!

speaker: Niles
text: [_sniffing_] What an odd combination of odors.  Smells like a fish died, and all the other fish sent flowers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's time for Dad's annual ice-fishing trip to Lake Nomahegan.

speaker: Martin
text: Yep, I'm getting my gear ready.  Duke rented a cabin right on the lake, and I'm bringing the bait and the pork rinds. Now, just 'cause your old man's going out of town, I don't want you boys throwing any wild parties.

speaker: Frasier
text: How can we if you're taking all the pork rinds?

speaker: Niles
text: I can't figure it out. [_probes a finger in the tackle box_] How could a fish be so dumb as to put its mouth around -- Ow!  _He jerks his finger back and puts it in his mouth.  The phone rings. Daphne answers._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello?  Oh, hello!  Yes, he's right here. [_to Martin_] It's Duke.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh! [_takes phone_] Hey, Duke! [_face falls_] Oh, I'm sorry. Yeah, sure I understand.  Hey, we'll do it next year.  Yeah, we've had too many good times up there to let this tradition die. [_laughs_] Yeah, yeah, I love ya, you big lug!  OK, bye.

speaker: Daphne
text: Your trip's been canceled?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, Duke's back's out again.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, what a shame.  You were so looking forward to it.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I still have the cabin.  But I can't go alone...

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, look, as much as I'd like to do something with you this weekend, I'm afraid ice fishing just isn't it.  Oh, look, look, here's an idea!  You know what, they're doing a revival of "The Iceman Cometh" playing downtown!  Now, you see, we could catch a matinee, and then go out for sushi, and stay well within the same theme music, you know?

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks, anyway.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'd go, but to me the pleasure of fishing has always been waiting for the men to return with their catch.  Oh, I can still see my brothers' friends coming back from the lake, their chiseled faces all ruddy and wind-burnt.  Ooh, they were so masculine, I just couldn't wait to panfry their kippers!

speaker: Niles
text: I'll go ice fishing, Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: Really, are you sure?

speaker: Niles
text: Unless you don't want me to...

speaker: Martin
text: No, I do!  Oh, this'll be great!

speaker: Frasier
text: You, ice-fishing?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, why not?  I've always thought of myself as a man of the great al fresco.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you get a runny nose watching figure skating on TV.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, thanks, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: It's the very least I can do if it'll help save your trip for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, Niles, that's quite a gesture.  But I mean, really, ice-fishing?  In an arctic tundra where large men spit and it freezes in their beards?

speaker: Niles
text: After you've seen Maris's interpretive dance group perform "Afternoon of a Faun" in the east garden, the wilderness holds no terror. _FADE TO:  Scene Three -- Apartment The next morning.  Daphne is making sandwiches in the kitchen. Frasier comes in._

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Good morning!  Lovely day, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're in a good mood.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, well, as much as I love your father, with him gone it's going to be a wonderful weekend... care to make it perfect?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry to disappoint you, but I am staying.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I found the thermos!  Be sure to make that coffee extra- strong!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hey, how you doing, chief?  Yeah, I know you want to go with me, but we're gonna be on the ice, it'll be too cold for you.  Yeah, I love ya, you little mutt!  Well, I better go make sure I have everything.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did he just say "I love you" to the dog?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, that's nothing.  I had an aunt who used to say, "good night, Mr. Vanderpump" to a hat rack.

speaker: Frasier
text: Does he say that to Eddie a lot?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I try to give them their privacy.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Daphne, I'm just curious.  I don't mean to sound maudlin, but, you know I can't remember Dad ever saying that to me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you know what a crusty old git your dad is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, but he says it to Eddie, you know he said it to Duke the other day on the phone...

speaker: Daphne
text: Duke and your father go way back.  He's his chum.

speaker: Frasier
text: And I'm not?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, you know when your dad wants to go fishing, at least Duke will go with him.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you're suggesting that I go along and pretend I'm enjoying myself, doing something that gives me absolutely no pleasure at all, just to hear the words "I love you?"

speaker: Daphne
text: Why not?  Women have been doing it for centuries.  _Daphne goes back to the kitchen.  The doorbell rings.  Frasier opens the door to Niles, who is decked out head-to-toe in brand new winter clothes and fishing paraphernalia, including an oversized fur hat._

speaker: Niles
text: Call me Ishmael.  [_N.B. The first line of "Moby Dick."_]

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, Niles, look at you!  Now are you sure you're gonna be warm enough?

speaker: Niles
text: No problem there.  I dressed in layers -- Polo, Eddie Bauer, and Timberland.

speaker: Frasier
text: You look like a skinny Elmer Fudd.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, wait'll you see all the stuff I got.  I had no idea how much I liked fishing until I realized all the shopping involved.  Graphite poles...

speaker: Martin
text: Wow!

speaker: Niles
text: And, [_takes out a pair of blue seat cushions_] Hot Buns!

speaker: Martin
text: Wow!

speaker: Niles
text: They're heated seat cushions.  You microwave them and they stay toasty warm for hours.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, maybe I was a little hasty...

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, here we are, some snacks for the trip, or-- [_sees Niles and laughs_] Oh, Dr. Crane, look at you in your new togs!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, quite an outfit, huh?  The fish'll see him coming!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, well, the salesman certainly did!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you know, I feel kind of bad that I turned you down when you invited me...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't worry about it.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait'll you taste this freshly smoked turkey jerky!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Frasier_] For heaven's sakes, you know you want to go, so why don't you just ask him?

speaker: Frasier
text: How can I?  I already said I didn't want to.

speaker: Martin
text: [_tasting the jerky_] Oh, that's delicious!

speaker: Niles
text: No, don't put it back in the bag!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles, come on, it's getting late.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, yes, guess we'd better hit the road.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, guys, it's kind of a long trip.  Are you sure you're up to the drive?

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, I'm getting some mixed signals here.  You don't want to go with us, do you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right!  Better than hearing you nag, nag, nag all the time!  Fine, I'll go!  _He storms to his room, leaving Martin and Niles confused.  FADE TO:_  **PROOF THAT HELL REALLY DOES FREEZE OVER**  _Scene Four -- Cabin A small, square cabin on the surface of the lake -- essentially a wooden box with a trapdoor in the center of the floor.  There are three wooden benches against the walls, but no beds._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, come on!  The ice isn't gonna break, this lake's been frozen solid for three months.  _Frasier stumbles through the door, carrying a large thermos and doing his best not to look thoroughly miserable._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm-I'm sorry, Dad.  It's just that when you said Duke rented a cabin "on the lake," this is not what I had in mind.

speaker: Martin
text: It's a cabin.  It's on the lake.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes -- a few degrees warmer, it'll be IN the lake.

speaker: Niles
text: That was amazing!  I've never felt so in touch with nature!

speaker: Martin
text: What happened?

speaker: Niles
text: For the first time in my life, I just urinated outdoors!

speaker: Niles
text: Another cup of coffee, I'll go back and dot the "I!" [_looks around_] Oh Dad, this is great!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah... well, Frasier doesn't think so.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's not that I'm complaining.  It's just that I thought it would be something more... well, lake-_adjacent_.  Are we actually going to sleep in here?

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughing_] Who is this rube?  Maybe we can trick him into touching his tongue to the bait bucket!

speaker: Martin
text: No, we're fishing here, we're sleeping someplace else. Remember where we turned off the highway?  Well, right down from there is the Bed 'N Bass Motel.

speaker: Frasier
text: "Bed 'N Bass" -- yes, one of the finer fish-themed hotels.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, what do we do?  We make a hole in the ice with this little corkscrew-thingy and then just start fishing?

speaker: Niles
text: It's called an "auger."

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, imagine my embarrassment.

speaker: Niles
text: [_handing Martin one of two seat cushions_] Here's your Hot Buns, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: What am I gonna sit on?

speaker: Niles
text: The auger's free. [_off Frasier's look_] Oh, all right, come on, come on, here.  _He slides over, leaving half of his own seat cushion free. Frasier sits beside him.  FADE TO:_  _Scene Five -- Cabin The guys are sitting side by side on the bench.  A fishing rod is mounted over the open trapdoor, with the line dangling down a hole in the ice.  Nothing's happening.  Frasier covertly pulls his sleeve up and sneaks a glance at his watch._

speaker: Martin
text: I saw that.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not bored.  I was simply wondering how long we've been sitting here enjoying ourselves.

speaker: Niles
text: If the fish don't feel peckish just now, we'll pass the time in good conversation.  Dad, did you know that Lake Nomahegan was formed by the retreat of several glaciers during the Cenozoic Era?

speaker: Frasier
text: Which, coincidentally, is the last time anyone caught a fish in it.

speaker: Martin
text: How'd you know that, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, last night I was browsing through "Fielding's Geological History of Western Canada."  It's fascinating! For example, did you know this very lake is eighty-nine meters deep and boasts fifty varieties of fish!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Alex, I'll take "Bodies of Water" for five hundred!

speaker: Niles
text: It has lake trout, rainbow trout, wall-eyed pike--

speaker: Frasier
text: How would you like to be sleeping with them?!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you know, you could learn a thing or two from your brother about getting into the spirit of things.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry, it's just that my back hurts, I'm hungry, and I'm tired of sitting here trying to warm up one bun at a time in twenty-degree weather!  That's negative six degrees Celsius, a system named after Anders Celsius, the famed Swedish astronomer and compulsive temperature-taker!  Niles, switch!

speaker: Niles
text: I believe you're on my side.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am not.

speaker: Niles
text: You've crossed the border!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_getting up_] Oh my God, I don't even know why I'm here!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm thinking the same thing myself.

speaker: Martin
text: Now, guys, come on!

speaker: Niles
text: If you're having such a terrible time, why don't you just head back to the Bed 'N Bass?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh fine, that's just what I need, a brisk five-mile hike through sub-freezing temperature.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, for God's sake, take the car, you can pick us up later.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine.

speaker: Niles
text: [_searching his pocket_] Oh, no.  There's a hole in my pocket.

speaker: Martin
text: You lost the keys?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no.  Where?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, if I knew where, they wouldn't be lost!  They could be anywhere between here and the car.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, good luck finding them, it's been snowing all day.

speaker: Niles
text: Great -- we're gonna have to stay here all night.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is just dandy!  By morning we'll be Stoafer's Frozen Entrees for wolves!

speaker: Martin
text: [_points under the bench_] Hey, wait a minute, is that them over there?

speaker: Niles
text: Where? [_sees them_] Oh, oh, oh, thank God! [_picks them up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, mister, I don't trust you.  Give me those right now.

speaker: Niles
text: Fine, Mr. Big Brother! _He tosses them to Frasier -- well, "toss" being used loosely, more like an anemic lob that sends the keys plummeting down the fishing hole._

speaker: Niles
text: Nice catch!

speaker: Frasier
text: Me?  You throw like a girl!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey come on, let's not panic.  You know, we're gonna be fine staying here all night.  You know, the same thing happened to me and Duke about ten years ago.

speaker: Niles
text: You dropped your car keys down the hole?

speaker: Martin
text: No, we're not idiots.  The car battery died.  But the three of us made it through the night just fine.

speaker: Niles
text: You, Duke, and who?

speaker: Martin
text: My old drinking buddy, Mr. James Beam!  You're not the only one who went out and got some fishing supplies.

speaker: Frasier
text: Boy, I never thought I'd end up yearning for the Bed �N Bass. [_takes a swig_] Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: [_taking a sherry glass from his bag_] Yes, please!  _Frasier fills the sherry glass, as Martin rolls his eyes.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Six -- Cabin The boys are waiting out the day.  Each has a bench to himself. Suddenly they hear a low creaking sound._

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, what was that?

speaker: Martin
text: Just the ice cracking underneath us.

speaker: Martin
text: Relax, it happens all the time.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, if we do fall in we'll have ninety seconds until hypothermia sets in.

speaker: Frasier
text: One more fact, you're going in that hole!

speaker: Niles
text: [_defiantly_] The wall-eyed pike--

speaker: Frasier
text: OK, that's it!

speaker: Martin
text: Stop it!  Will you guys stop going after each other already? I know, we got to lighten things up around here.  Hey, we're drinking, we need a drinking song!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right.  Ooh, I know, there's a wonderful drinking song from "La Traviata" called, uh, "Libiamo Brindisi!"

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, no, that's from "Rigoletto."

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's from "La Traviata!"  _Frasier starts singing "Libiamo" in a brassy opera voice. Niles tries to correct his pitch, singing the same word in a different voice.  Martin rolls his eyes.  FADE TO:_  _Scene Seven - Cabin A While Later.  After a few more drinks, the three Crane men are sitting on the same bench, singing "Libiamo Brindisi."  They're slow, and off-key, but at least they're in unison._

speaker: Frasier/Niles/Martin
text: Si, ne scopra, ne scopra, Il nuovo di...

speaker: Martin
text: That was great!  What's the second verse?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know, it's in Italian! [_laughter_] Another drink, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, I'll take a pass on that, I got to go use the facilities.  But, I'll be right back, so keep a light on in the window for me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm still thirsty, Niles.  Here, "Beam" me up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, do you mind if I ask you a personal question? What the hell are you doing here?

speaker: Niles
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, this whole "Sergeant Niles of the Yukon" act. I mean, come on, it can't be all to impress Daphne--

speaker: Niles
text: It's not an act!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, in twenty years, I've never heard you comment on fish except to say that the sauce had separated.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.  I'll tell you.  You promise not to laugh?

speaker: Frasier
text: You'll have to take that hat off.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, two years ago when you took Dad in, I thought I was getting away with something.  Watching you two get closer, I started to think maybe I was missing out on something.

speaker: Frasier
text: You want him?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, let me finish.  I just really feel the need to make a connection.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles, I think you've made a connection.  It just seems a little extreme though, you know?  You probably could have accomplished the same thing if you'd just taken him to Captain Andy's Surf N' Turf!

speaker: Niles
text: And miss out on all the fun of memorizing 101 useless fish facts and buying a large battery-operated wardrobe? [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: So you're having just a bad a time as I am!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh, oh, worse!  At least you have the fun of complaining, I have to feign enthusiasm!  Oh, oh... [_sinks down_] I really am King of the Ninnies, aren't I?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no.  Don't be reaching for that scepter yet, son.  Want to know the reason I came up here?

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: It was just to hear him say the words "I love you."

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, well, you know -- he said it to Duke, he said it to Eddie.  He's never said it to me.

speaker: Niles
text: Surely you don't put yourself up there with Eddie? [_they laugh_] Oh, Frasier, you know he loves you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yeah, of course I do.  I'm being ridiculous, I know that. I mean, look at the guy!  He's content just to sit here freezing his buns off because we're sitting here with him. It's just I guess I just got a little obsessed about, you know, hearing it.  Well, I mean, you know that Maris loves you, right?  But it's still nice to hear it.

speaker: Niles
text: I imagine it would be, but let's stick to attainable goals.

speaker: Frasier
text: As they laugh the laugh of the damned.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I did it!  I wrote my name out there!  I had to borrow an "N" from Niles, but I did it!

speaker: Frasier
text: We're leaving quite the urological crossword puzzle out there, aren't we?

speaker: Martin
text: What were you guys laughing at?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, nothing.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on!  Don't leave your old man out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... all right, O.K.  I was just explaining to Niles the reason why I drove all this way up here was to... I was hoping I'd hear you say the words, "I love you." [_laughs_]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, jeez, I leave you for two minutes and you have to start thinking.  Isn't it enough that we're just here having a good time?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: You know, every year in this country thousands of guys go fishing, and love never enters into it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, okay, forget about it.

speaker: Martin
text: Thank you.  Can we just go on fishing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure.

speaker: Niles
text: A fisherman in Oshkosh, Wisconsin stared into one of these holes for twenty years before he caught his first fish.

speaker: Frasier
text: Haven't we been here that long?

speaker: Martin
text: Anyway, just because I didn't say it doesn't mean I don't mean it or feel it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, that's exactly what we were saying.

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well, my dad never said it, but I know he felt it. I mean, feeling it's the same as saying it, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you don't have to say it.

speaker: Martin
text: [_upset_] Well, did it ever occur to you that... maybe I want to say it?  You know, your mother used to get all over me about not saying stuff too. [_pause_] Well, I can't say it if you're looking at me!

speaker: Niles
text: Would it help you if we left?

speaker: Martin
text: Just for that, I'm doing you second!

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know why it's so hard.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, listen, you know you can say it.  I mean, I heard you say it to Duke.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's different, I said, "I love _ya_!"  Ya!

speaker: Frasier
text: We'd take "ya."

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if I'm gonna do it, I'll do it right. [_sniff_] Frasier...

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier... I love you.  Niles... I love you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, Dad.  I love you too.

speaker: Niles
text: And I love you too.

speaker: Niles
text: But I hate ice-fishing!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's the last time you'll have to come out and do that.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, in that case I REALLY love you!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, thanks, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, look at that, that's so cute.  When you say it to him, he blushes!  I love you!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no!

speaker: Niles
text: I love you...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on!

speaker: Frasier
text: I love you...

speaker: Martin
text: No, cut that out...  _Niles and Frasier crowd Martin, repeating "I love you." Martin tries to shoo them away.  Onto this strange scene a park ranger appears in the doorway._

speaker: Niles
text: Come on, give us a kiss!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, shut up!

speaker: Ranger
text: [_knocking on the glass_] Excuse me!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, officer!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, we're saved!

speaker: Ranger
text: You guys are gonna have to come off the ice for the night.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, we can't, we lost the car keys.

speaker: Ranger
text: Then I'll take you to your motel, and you can call a locksmith in the morning.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks, officer!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's a wonderful idea, you're quite a sport.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!  Yes!  Thank you, we love you!

speaker: Niles
text: Ya!  We love ya!

speaker: Martin
text: We've been drinking a little.
